title: OpenType Features for Arabic font in Fontlab. Help.
content:
Hi everyone.

I am new in the typography world, so I'm still learning new stuff.

I started creating Arabic font and I need all knowledge you are willing to share :)

I created design for each letter in every form and imported them in Fontlab Studio 5.1.  
I still need to define final, initial and medial form through OpenType features (and ofcourse mark positioning).  
I don't know what to type, what code, so if you know some good 'instructions' for this please let me know :)

Aleksandra
author: Aleksandra2206

comments.content:
Hi  
Defining the features and lookups is a very technical and time-consuming job.  
As far as I know the only free example for VOLT was made by SIL for Sheherazade font - but it did not work for me, and I had to ask an Arab professional.  
There is an excellent booklet pdf that may be helpful to you:  
 [http://www.khtt.net/page/31753/en](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114152/http:/www.khtt.net/page/31753/en "http://www.khtt.net/page/31753/en")  
I think you have to join [http://www.khtt.net/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114152/http:/www.khtt.net/ "http://www.khtt.net/") to access this.  
Good luck  
Vladimir
